creator: tymberwlf@yahoo.ca
text:
Apache 2.0.48 causes CPU to max at 100% on Windows 2000

Windows 2000 on a clean install with no other Service packs/patches, firewalls 
etc installed. 
Install default of 2.0.48 with no changes to config. Start Apache manually or 
via the service, cpu climbs and stays at 100%.

Install 2.0.47 on the same pc with NO changes. Start Apache with same default 
settings, and either by manual or service start, the cpu stays at a normal 
level.

This issue with 2.0.48 was also recreated on a Windows 2000 pc with all MS 
update patches and SP4 installed. 2.0.47 worked fine.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Are you running Apache with privilages as a service, or as a console app?

  Do you need to process a request to cause this behavior, or will it climb
  before any requests are recieved?

  You don't mention, were any third party modules were installed?

  Thanks for your report, please provide some additional details to help us
  narrow down which part of the server is suspect.

creator: tymberwlf@yahoo.ca
text:
This issue occurs with Apache running as a service or through the console. I 
used the default httpd.conf with no changes except for the hostname and  
ServerAdmin email address. This same httpd.conf works fine for 2.0.47.

Upon startup, the cpu climbs and stays at 100% right away and it will not hand 
any requests.

No other 3rd party modules/software installed. This was intially tested on 
cleanly formatted win2000 pro test pc with ALL default install parameters. The 
second test was on  production win2000 pro pc with all the latest MS security 
patches and Win2000 Service Pack 4. There also no other software installed. It 
is interesting to note that 2.0.47 runs perfectly fine on both pc's.
No useful into (to me anyway) in the log files, even at the debug level.

To rule out any operating system issues. I installed 1.3.29 on both pc's and 
again there is no issues at all.

At this point, because the original pc is a test and demo pc, I am willing to 
reformat and reinstall again if requested. I would like to have 2.0.48 running 
on it if at all possible.

Apache 2.0.48 is displaying an application error when it is closed (you can only
end task it. No changes to the apache config or the pc operating system.

The instruction at "0x77f8aa57" referenced memory at "0x00000014" the memory
could not be read.
"Click on OK to terminate the program."
creator: tymberwlf@yahoo.ca

text:
Found out what the issue is. The cpu climbing to 100% is caused by having 
Mcafee anti-virus running. Once Mcafee was disabled, Apache 2.0.48 runs fine. 
This is not an idea situation and I do not wish to close this bug report as 
previous 2.0.x and 1.3.x versions of Apache co-exist fine alongside of Mcafee...
creator: tymberwlf@yahoo.ca
